The Kela Rotta Program

With the revolutionary money distribution system known as KELA, Finland has freed its population to spend their days in meaningful activities, like playing video games and watching anime.

The constitution of Finland guarantees every citizen a completely work-free life.

What if I'm not a citizen?

Everyone is welcome

Foreigners living in Finland on a temporary basis have the same right to basic social assistance as citizens. In the case of asylum seekers, even superior services are sometimes provided.

The more family members you bring, the more money KELA will be able to provide you!

The Money

The most common monthly payments

  • 514 euros for whatever the Rotta wishes
  • Rent paid for in full, provided that there aren't too many extra bedrooms
  • Electricity
  • Water
  • Healthcare & medication
  • A computer and a phone, if the Rotta does not possess them
  • Government IDs, miscellaneous education and extra assistance
